gptanswer:
We can use the half angle formula for tangent:
\[\tan \frac{15^\circ}{2} = \sqrt{\frac{1 - \cos 15^\circ}{1 + \cos 15^\circ}}.\]Then
\begin{align*}
\tan 15^\circ &= 2 \tan \frac{15^\circ}{2} \cdot \frac{1}{1 - \tan^2 \frac{15^\circ}{2}} \\
&= 2 \cdot \frac{\sqrt{\frac{1 - \cos 15^\circ}{1 + \cos 15^\circ}}}{1 - \frac{1 - \cos 15^\circ}{1 + \cos 15^\circ}} \\
&= 2 \cdot \frac{\sqrt{\frac{1 - \cos 15^\circ}{1 + \cos 15^\circ}}}{\frac{2 \cos 15^\circ}{1 + \cos 15^\circ}} \\
&= \boxed{2 - \sqrt{3}}.
\end{align*}
